intro: Haitia buchii, commonly known as the Haitian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has oval, dark green leaves. It is relatively small, reaching heights of about 30 to 60 centimeters. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native region.
